channel.title: ajax on Roy Tang
channel.description: Recent content in ajax on Roy Tang

item.title: Reply to 'how to detect incoming chat message?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3146067/how-to-detect-incoming-chat-message:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'how to detect incoming chat message?' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3146067/how-to-detect-incoming-chat-message:

You have to use polling, but you can use a technique called Comet which involves long-polling, i.e. sending out an ajax request that will be held by the server until a chat request comes in.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comet_(programming))

item.title: Reply to 'jQuery, how to call a function while passing a variable' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1831116/jquery-how-to-call-a-function-while-passing-a-variable:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'jQuery, how to call a function while passing a variable' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1831116/jquery-how-to-call-a-function-while-passing-a-variable:

Try wrapping it in a new function object:

$.get("InfoRetrieve", { },function() { addContent(data) });
